FuncDef:
The remark 8021p command configures an action of re-marking the 802.1p priority in VLAN packets in a traffic behavior.
The undo remark 8021p command deletes the configuration. The remark 8021p command configures an action of re-marking the 802.1p priority in VLAN packets in a traffic behavior. The undo remark 8021p command deletes the configuration. By default, an action of re-marking the 802.1p priority in VLAN packets is not configured in a traffic behavior.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the 802.1p priority in VLAN packets.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 7. A larger value indicates a higher priority in VLAN packets.

Inherits the 802.1p priority in the inner tag.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

ExtraInfo: To provide differentiated services based on the inner 802.1p priority in VLAN packets, run the remark 8021p command to configure the device to re-mark the inner 802.1p priority in VLAN packets in a traffic behavior.
